str2: The greatest, the most, very great. Irregular superlative of polus; the largest number or very large.
From a derivative of echo; a throng; by implication, the rabble; by extension, a class of people; figuratively, a riot.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To spread, make a bed. Or simpler stronnuo, prolongation from a still simpler stroo, ; to 'strew, ' i.e. Spread.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: Himself, herself, itself.
A long flowing outer garment, tunic. Neuter of a presumed derivative of ennumi; a dress.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A way, road, journey, path. Apparently a primary word; a road; by implication, a progress; figuratively, a mode or means.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Other, another (of more than two), different. A primary word; 'else, ' i.e. Different.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A primary verb; to 'chop'; specially, to beat the breast in grief.
A young tender shoot, then: a branch; met: of descendants. From klao; a twig or bough.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A tree. Probably from drus; a tree.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To spread, make a bed. Or simpler stronnuo, prolongation from a still simpler stroo, ; to 'strew, ' i.e. Spread.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A way, road, journey, path. Apparently a primary word; a road; by implication, a progress; figuratively, a mode or means.
